contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather.
Let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, rain started on Jeju Island and the south coast this afternoon, and these showers are slowly expanding across to the southern parts of the country.

Yes, Conn-young. Rain clouds have formulated in the South on Jeju Island and coastal areas. By tomorrow these rain clouds will have spread across the southern half the nation including to Chungcheong-do Province and will expand to Gangwon-do Province as well. Most of the rain is expected to end by tomorrow night. However, on Jeju Island and in parts of Gangwon-do Province, rain is forecasted to last until Friday.

Heavy rain is expected in Jeju and southern coastal areas. In Jeju, we can expect up to 200 millimeters…the south coast can expect up to 80 millimeters, 10 to 50 in other southern regions and 5 to 20 in parts of Chungcheong-do and Gangwon-do provinces.

For tomorrow, Seoul and Daegu will begin the day at 20 degrees Celsius, Gyeongju and Busan at 19.

Daytime highs in the capital will reach up to 28 degrees, Daegu and Gyeongju 23, and Busan at 21.

Throughout the week, Seoul will continue to see sweltering spells of heat with temperatures hitting their peak at 31 degrees for the weekend.

For Korea's neighbors, Beijing will also have a sweltering daytime highs of 33 degrees.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Heavy rain of up to 200mm on Jeju Island, south coast
Updated: 2020-06-17 17:03:00 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, depending on where you are you today will need sunblock or rain gear. About the rain, those of you on Jeju will need to prepare for downpours for the next few days. It will rain from this afternoon and could pound Jeju with up to 200 millimeters.

Temperature-wise, compared to yesterday, readings will be a few notches lower for the southern parts of the country, while central regions will be as hot or even hotter today, including Chuncheon and Gangneung.

Central parts of the country will be under mostly sunny skies with strong UV rays so don't forget your sunblock, southern regions will see more clouds rolling in as the day goes on

Seoul will see hot, sunny and humid weather for the next 5 days while this Sunday marks Summer Solstice. The heat will get even stronger next week.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

Sunblock needed for central regions, umbrella for Jeju
Updated: 2020-06-17 08:09:15 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, those of you on Jeju will need to prepare for downpours for the next few days. It will rain from this afternoon, gradually spreading to Jeollanam-do Province by late tonight. Rain will pound down on Jeju into Friday, up to 200 millimeters of torrential showers.

Temperature wise, readings will go down a few notches, most parts will see highs in the upper twenties this afternoon. Southern regions though will notice increasing humidity.

Morning lows in most parts are similar to the same time yesterday, ranging from 17 to 21 degrees Celsius. Seoul, Daejeon at 20.

The top readings in Seoul and Daegu will be 29 degrees Celsius, Jeju just getting up to 24 degrees, don't forget your rain gear.

Southern provinces will see rain into Friday while central parts will have hot and humid weather for the next 5 days.

contents.headline:
Downpours on Jeju from this afternoon
Updated: 2020-06-17 06:22:58 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather.
Let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, we can expect cooler spells in the south of the country tomorrow with some rain on the waying. But Seoul will stay hot at around 30 degrees?

Yes, Conn-young a scorching 30 degrees Celsius again tomorrow with lots of sunshine. In terms of air quality, though, it'll be poor in some areas, especially in the west. In the Seoul metropolitan area and the provinces just to the south of it, ultrafine dust levels are expected to stand at 'temporarily bad' levels until tomorrow noon.

And showers are in store from tomorrow afternoon. Rain is expected to start on Jeju Island in the daytime and will expand to Jeollanam-do Province overnight. By Thursday, the rain will have spread across the southern part of the country. Most of it is forecast to be over by the end of the day.

Tomorrow morning, we’ll begin the day with temperatures close to today’s. Seoul will start off at 20 degrees Daegu and Busan at 19.

The mercury will reach up to 29 degrees in the capital. In the southern parts of the country, daytime highs will be much cooler than today’s with cloudy spells.

Daytime UV rays will be very strong throughout South Korea, so please be aware. That also goes for Korea's neighbors, Tokyo tomorrow.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Heat to continue tomorrow... Rain in store in Jeju and southern regions
Updated: 2020-06-16 17:03:34 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, it's going to be hotter than yesterday for most parts of the country.
However, regions on the east coast, including Gangneung and Sokcho, will get some relief from the heat, highs dropping 5 to 7 degrees today thanks to cool easterly winds.

Busan will be at 27 degrees, western cities including Seoul, Gwangju and Daejeon hitting 30 under a fair amount of sunshine and strong UV rays.

Parts of Gangwon-do and Gyeongsangbuk-do Provinces could see sporadic rain of 5 to 20 millimeters during the day due to atmospheric instability.

The summer warmth should continue for most regions. Meanwhile, so far, the weather looks promising and clear for Sunday for the partial solar eclipse. I will keep you updated while Jeju will see monsoon rain from tomorrow into Friday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Heat relief in east coast, sweltering day for rest
Updated: 2020-06-16 06:10:53 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather.
Let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, it looks like we'll be seeing temperatures hovering around 30 degrees Celsius throughout the nation tomorrow but the extreme heat on the east coast will be eased. What can you tell us?

Well, Conn-young. Sunny spells are expected throughout the week for inland regions, including the capital. The heatwave alert on the east coast is forecasted to be lifted for tomorrow. On Wednesday, monsoon rainfall is likely to commence on Jeju Island. Rain clouds will then expand towards Jeollanam-do and Gyeongsangnam-do provinces on Thursday.

We’ll continue to see strong UV rays during the daytime tomorrow. Excluding parts of Gangwon-do Province and Jeju Island, where ‘high’ levels are forecasted, the rest of the peninsula will stand at ‘very high’ levels, so make sure to wear plenty of sunblock.

For tomorrow, Seoul, Gwangju and Daegu will start off at 19 degrees Celsius.

For the daytime, the east coast will be 5 to 7 degrees lower than today's due to incoming cold easterly winds. Seoul and Gwangju will continue to stay hot at 30 degrees.

As we get closer to the weekend, Seoul will see sweltering heat with highs hovering around 30 degrees.

For Korea's neighbors, Beijing will see scorching highs of 35 degrees, with a 'very high' UV ray index.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Daytime heat to continue tomorrow with high UV ray index
Updated: 2020-06-15 17:07:08 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, regions along Korea's east coast will see scorching hot afternoon temperatures. Gangneung in Gangwon-do and Gyeongsan in Gyeongsangbuk-do Provinces are under a heat wave advisory and it's going to be as hot as Sunday for the capital.

For a closer look, Gyeongju and Chuncheon will be at 32 degrees Celsius, Seoul at 28, not too bad at all. But we'll see strong sunshine throughout the day.

Very strong UV rays will beat down on us during the day. Sinan and Jindo County in Jeollanam-do Province will endure extreme levels Take all precautions possible, we need be sunsmart today.

Seoul will see rising temperatures as we head into the end of the week hovering in the low 30's again. Jeju will receive monsoon rain from Wednesday afternoon into Friday so we are forecast to have higher humidity.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
